trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.SettingChanging"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Configuration.SettingChangingEventArgs> class provides data for the <xref:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.SettingChanging> event, which signals that the value of an application settings property is about to change.
The most common source for this event is the `get` accessor of the <xref:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase.Item%2A> method in the <xref:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase> class.
Because <xref:System.Configuration.SettingChangingEventArgs> is derived from <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs>, the handler has the option of canceling the write operation.
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SettingChangingEventArgs"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Configuration.SettingChangingEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor just assigns the values of the parameters to the corresponding properties in the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingChangingEventArgs> class.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name of the application setting.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing a category description of the setting.
Often this parameter is set to the application settings group name.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the application settings key.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the new value to be assigned to the application settings property.
`true` to cancel the event; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the new value being assigned to the application settings property.
The actual type of the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingChangingEventArgs.NewValue%2A> property should be compatible with the settings property being set.
The latter is available though the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty.PropertyType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsProperty> class.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the new value to be assigned to the application settings property.
Gets the application settings property category.
All application settings belong to a application settings group.

The group name can be explicitly supplied by decorating the class with a <xref:System.Configuration.SettingsGroupNameAttribute>; otherwise, one is generated using the name of the settings wrapper class.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing a category description of the setting.
Typically, this parameter is set to the application settings group name.
Gets the application settings key associated with the property.

Each settings wrapper class, derived from <xref:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase>, has an associated settings key, which is a string that helps disambiguate different instances of the same wrapper in a single application.
Because each wrapper class defines a set of properties that represent application settings, the settings key can similarly help disambiguate their use.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the application settings key.
Gets the name of the application setting associated with the application settings property.

Typically the settings wrapper class, derived from <xref:System.Configuration.ApplicationSettingsBase>, will be constructed so that the name of the application settings property will be the same as its associated application setting.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name of the application setting.
